data.title: Mary S. Rothmann Is Betrothed To Philip Wardner Wilkinson
data.text:
CHATHAM, N. Y., March 16—Mr. and Mrs. William A. Rothmann have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Stewart Rothmann, to Philip Wardner Wilkinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert T. Wilkinson of Mount Kisco.

Miss Rothmann, who is with the photography and slide library at the Metro politan Museum of Art, is an alumna of West Virginia Wesleyan College and re ceived a master's degree in art history from the Univer sity of Denver. Her father, who is retired, was with Dun & Bradstreet, Inc., and oper ated a farming business here.

The future bride is the granddaughter of the late Arthur Coppell, who was a partner of Maitland, Coppeil & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange.

Her fiancé, a product mar keting manager for Econo mics Laboratory, Inc., in New York, was graduated from Colgate and received a master's degree in business from Northwestern University. His father, who is retired, was vice president of the W. T. Grant Company.
